reviews.text: I had a booking at this hotel through a hotel website. I espeicially picked this hotel for its location on the Promenade des Anglais. 3 Star hotel at a reasonable price for the location. It was my last day in France and I arrived in Nice alone to be told by the hotel "Sorry your room is not available due to water damage". "We are full and have no more rooms". They said they recommended another hotel one block behind as they still have rooms available. I told them I had come all the way from Australia, Im alone and wanted this hotel as a treat to myself for my 40th birthday. It was all about the location. I told them I would take the room as it is. They said "Sorry there is nothing we can do we are full". I asked for a Manager. I was told "There is no manager". I went to look at the other hotel a small hotel a block behind. I was VERY DISAPPOINTED. I told Le Royal hotel about my disappointment. And still, they could do nothing. I must have sat there for one hour and saw other customers arriving much later than me from the airport etc.. and they were given rooms! Why not me? I asked them this question and they could not answer. An honest answer would have been nice. I had wasted my whole evening talking and waiting for my room that just was not given to me. I felt like a criminal, or that I had done something wrong. I, the customer, who had a booking, felt very unwelcome and then left as they were not providing me with a room. I was terribly upset, embarassed and disappointed at they way I was treated. This ruined my night in Nice. I phoned the next day to speak to the manager, I was told "The Manager is not available".
reviews.title: Never Again!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night, but reminded me of an Victorian English seaside hotel. You have to accept it for what it is, faded splendour. The decor is not stunning the bathrooms are a little old but all is clean and our room and bathroom were very large. With a few extras it could be a great hotel and doubtless charge far more. There is no tea/coffee facilities in the room or fridge. That said the location is absolutely fabulous right on the Promenade des Anglais with everything very close by. Don't go if you want a sumptuous modern boutique hotel, do go if you want be at the centre of everything and enjoy sitting on the front watching the world go by.
reviews.title: Faded splendour, great location

reviews.text: Hotel has a nice period feel to the reception area and nice terrace area.
reviews.title: Nice seafront position. Reasonable for 3 star hotel.

reviews.text: The room was not great, no luxuries, but adequate. City view was non existent, better to pay for seaview.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: There was no Internet for the five days we were there, which was disappointing as that was one of our criteria for booking.
reviews.title: Belated but briliant review

reviews.text: Beautiful location, with sea view and at the promenade des Anglais. However, the hotel looks very dated and is not very clean. Bar and breakfast area looked very much like a canteen. I also found the staff not very helpful and friendly, especially when ordering a drink at the terrace - the menu was thrown on the table without any greeting and it took ages before my order arrived. Reason for me to check-out after one night and move to another hotel.
reviews.title: Departed greatness

reviews.text: This place has some very helpful,courteous staff. It has a fantastic location on the Prom des Anglais. But it is in real need of some tlc. The rooms are tired and dated looking, and for the price, frankly not worth it.
reviews.title: Ok, but needs a refurb

reviews.text: We finished a long bike ride and the company we travelled with booked us in. It was good and considering it's location the bar was reasonably priced. The only issue was that we had booked a couple of extra nights and had to change rooms. This took most of the day to sort out however we didn't get told this so spent most of the day in swimming gear as there was no changing faculties. Not a massive problem but could have easily been resolved.
reviews.title: Clean hotel although the reception service is slow

reviews.text: Wow, for a hotel on the Promenade, it sure is a dung-heap. My room smelled of rotten cabbage and sewage, which is impressive considering I had a sea-view room with the ocean breeze coming in. No internet in rooms at all. Interiors badly need renovation. Not worth any price really. There are much better hotels nearby. 4/10
reviews.title: Not worth it at all

reviews.text: Great location for a hotel but that is about all it has going for it. The hotel is old and in bad need of renovating. Although our room was clean, the halls and room smelt of stale cigarette smoke and the walls were slightly discoloured, a yellowish tone. There are no tea or coffee facilities in the room. When we checked in to our room at 3pm the pillows were left stacked at the end of the bed without pillow cases. We had to ask reception twice for pillow cases and eventually after 9.30pm someone came to remove our pillows and give us 1 flat pillow and case each!
reviews.title: Rundown, in bad need of renovating!

reviews.text: I knew that this, like many other hotels in Europe are old and full of history; but it's such a pity when the extra care needed to maintain old things so that they retain some charm is evidently not there.
reviews.title: Glad I only stayed 1 night

reviews.text: It's clean but basic.
reviews.title: The worst hotel I have ever been to.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very disappointed by the level of service. I had to return to the reception 3 times just to get an acceptable room. First time, it had a double bed instead of 2 twin beds per my request. 2nd time, I got a room with twin beds but the toilet flush didn't work well and the room just looked way too depressing. 3rd time I finally got a much bigger room and a brighter toilet with everything working properly.
reviews.title: stay anywhere but @ the Le Royal !!!There are plenty hotels nearby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The worst part was - my passport and credit card was left with reception overnight. Nobody notified me even at the point of check out the next day. I realized I didn't have my passport 2 hours after leaving the hotel. An immediate call to them confirmed that they indeed had my passport. I wonder about their efforts to contact me, which should have been easy enough since I made my booking through hotel.com. I was just very relieved to get my documents back.
reviews.title: All things considered: Perfect choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Le Royal?? Definitely below even plebeian expectations, unfortunately.
reviews.title: charmant hotel

reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is the lobby decor. As you enter the hotel you can really see the vintage charm of a great Victorian era - high ceilings, chandeliers, grand entrance, with friendly staff to greet you on arrival.
reviews.title: Vintage Charm, great location - rooms in need of some T.L.C

reviews.text: The bar serves reasonably priced drinks (with some nibbles) overlooking the promenade in amongst Jasmine and lemon trees. Staff were always helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Location is (almost) everything

reviews.text: The rooms, however, are in need of a refurbishment. Clean and comfortable, the wallpaper was old and some bathroom tiles are cracked. We stayed at the back of the hotel on the 5th floor, without the sea view.
reviews.title: The worst hotel experience of my entire life

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location, a 10 minute stroll from the old town, and you can also catch the number 98 bus from Nice Airport (15min transfer) which stops opposite the hotel.
reviews.title: Be realistic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only reason I have scored it relatively low on the sleep quality was the impromptu alarm at 00:30 in the morning.
reviews.title: flatravler
